projects.title: TodXpy
projects.intro: A simple and easy to use yet configurable todo app.

projects.title: SlackGroovy
projects.intro: An app to create separate playlists for each Slack workspace registered and uses the groovy bot to add a link to the playlist. Backend developed using Django and FrontEnd using ReactJS.

projects.title: sim-C
projects.intro: Often people have trouble programming in C (especially beginners) due to its low level syntax and unavailability of stable third party libraries. We present sim-C a high-level front end for C which creates a dynamically typed syntax for C. User can write code in this high level syntax and then compile it to optimized C code. sim-C does not process the code and simply translates it to C thus, there is no possibility of the code running slowly. So, with sim-C users can write code faster using the high level syntax and at the same time be able to harness the power and speed of a C program. Let us make C cool again.

projects.title: TemplateBuddy
projects.intro:
TemplateBuddy is a free platform where the users can create their resumes and research papers from a variety of templates that we have to offer.
The data once fed by the user is saved in his account and the user can just change the template and adjust the information he/she has to show.

projects.title: youtube-deno
projects.intro: Deno is a new JS and TS runtime, made by the creator of node.js, which many people are calling the "better" version of node.js. This project lets you incorporate core YouTube features, such as uploading videos, creating and managing playlists, searching for content, and almost any interaction with YouTube in your Deno application.

projects.title: MarvellOS
projects.intro:
This is a basic operating system GUI mock-up made from python GUI module tkinter. It has a number of interactive apps to navigate through.
There are 2 main screens, apart from the various app screens. At first, you're confronted with the welcome screen, where you're supposed to enter your password within 5 tries. On login, you enter the app drawer, where you can choose from a grid of apps.

projects.title: eduAlgo
projects.intro: A simple python package having modules of different algorithms to use in educational purposes.

projects.title: eduAlgo-app
projects.intro: The objective of this project is to develop an application for android OS, using which one can access to the documentation, codes and methods of the eduAlgo package.

projects.title: Ookla-Speedtest.net-Crawler
projects.intro: A python web crawler that fetches more than 25 billion pages of https://www.speedtest.net to fetch download speed, upload speed, latency, date, distance, country code, server ID, server name, sponsor name, sponsor URL, connection_mode, isp name, isp rating, test rank, test grade, test rating, path.

projects.title: Canvasboard

Canvasboard is an interactive board with plugins focusing on replacing the need of multiple platforms for teaching, presenting, managing or explaining your ideas. The interactive plugins are built using web technologies to ease your work right within a single platform.

More on https://github.com/Canvasbird/canvasboard

projects.intro: A web app for charity event organizers to connect and collaborate in real-time.

projects.title: gRPC-Chat-App
projects.intro: gRPC-Chat-App is a custom made chat app written in Golang. It uses terminal - 2 -terminal based model for connecting peers in a chat group. It uses gRPC protocol along with publisher-subscriber model for channelling the chat message among different peers.

projects.title: QP-Generator
projects.intro: A web app that helps everyone to generate question paper with ease. We will use the T5 paraphraser model to rephrase the questions.

projects.title: PyDataStructs
projects.intro:
Currently, the project aims to be a Python package for various data structures in computer science. Besides, we are also working on including parallel algorithms. To the best of our knowledge, a well-designed library/package which has covered most of the data structures and algorithms including their parallel implementation doesn't exist.

In future, i.e, after a few releases of the package when the software design will become stable, we also aim to provide APIs for the code in C++ and Java as well.

projects.title: CleanPy
projects.intro:
Organizes files in folders and helps you to clean your PC.
Organizing files means that the script moves the files to different folders. Currently it organizes audio files, video files, documents (word docs, PDFs etc), executable, images

Get started with coding exhilarating scripts that you can use to download PDFs from an Online Source or just to randomly like everyone's Instagram Post.

projects.title: SpeakEd
projects.intro: SpeakEd is a Community Platform developed for Community Leads and Volunteers as well as Speakers to come on a single Unified Platforms leading to greater visibility, helping you to find the right Speaker for your Event. With an integrated Portfolio Feature for Speakers, you would be able to find the Events, Workshops or Podcasts they have spoken at, and will allow you to contact them at ease in a secure manner. Speakers would be able to build their Portfolio around this, showcasing the speaking skills they have got along with the expertise and clarity that possess while teaching or instructing someone. This Community Application would allow Speakers to connect with Community Leads/Volunteers over their love for Community Building and helping out each other in an effective way, benefitting the Community in the longer run.

projects.title: Health-Log

Hospital authority can store new patients and it will automatically assign the doctor to each patient. Doctors can also check the allotted patient and fill the recent logs of each patient in each visit which will update the family members by the patient’s report. Hospitals can also receive the appointment request and also either accept it or maybe refer to another hospital through the app.

projects.title: Syl3D

projects.intro: Search Thousands Of Job Boards In Different Technologies From Over The World and show them at one dashboard

projects.title: IQPS
projects.intro:
Intelligent Question Paper Search (IQPS) is a search engine for semester question papers. It is an upgrade to the existing MFQP platform used by KGP students (qp.metakgp.org). It is a fully functional web-app written in Django, featuring paper search, filter, request and upload.
We need people with willingness to learn Python, Django, MySQL and Docker. The knowledge about none of them is required but a general experience in programming will help.
Potential projects are (not limited to):
- Improving the search algorithm (May require C++ and interfacing with MySQL)
- Enabling user log in system for paper uploads and requests. (Django models)
- Improving the UI. (HTML + CSS + JS)
- Easing out the Installation process and updating docs (Docker + Sphinx Docs)

projects.title: Node-OCR
projects.intro: A Rest API solution for Optical Character Recognition (OCR). The main objective of this project is to familiarise with REST APIs using ExpressJS and NodeJS and to provide a free and easy way to perform OCR on images and retrieve text from them. The OCR is made possible by Tesseract.js, a powerful JS framework.

projects.title: productivity_meter

Productivity meter helps in measuring productivity of solving problems, while studying.
This is used for tracking how much time you are thinking you spend in problem solving and how much time you actually spend solving problems.
This does so by measuring the delta between the time spent minus the time wasted due to small small distractions. It uses two simple javascript based timers to do so.

Deno is a runtime for Javascript and Typescript made by the creator of Node.Js. It aims to solve the things he regrets about Node.Js and will replace it eventually.

projects.title: CollegeBuddy

Most typing platforms simply present stories or random words to practice which works well for average people but not for the lethal, fast, perfectionist programmers who cannot afford to be slow and have typos when they code.

projects.title: codemon

A CLI tool to ace Competitive Programming Contests.
Mostly, the time of a competitive programmer is wasted in compiling, adding inputs, and debugging. Typing commands again and again wastes time, which we cannot afford during a contest.
Codemon takes care of everything else so that you only focus on writing correct code and implementing complex algorithms.

The tasks are laid out as GitHub issues, which involve debugging code and/or adding new features to the project, which are marked as 'bugs' and 'enhancements' respectively.

The game has no chance based elements, it's easy to get into, very fun and replayable, while very hard to master. Materialize and destroy! https://AncientBeast.com

Why should we stop at twitter? I think we can query LinkedIn, Facebook, probably any social platform.

projects.title: Solve the Maze
projects.intro: This project aims at finding the solution of perfect mazes, which is defined as a maze that has only one path from any point in the maze to any other point using the concepts of Image Processing using Open CV. Also, maze has no in-accessible sections, no circular paths and no open areas, but is of three dimentions 50*50, 20*20 and 5*5.

projects.title: Nebula-Frontend

We'll be using React.js for the front-end and flask for the backend. Even if you're a beginner and do not know enough about the development, feel free to join our slack channel. We're there to guide you.

projects.intro: This project aims to provide universities and communities with a platform that can be utilized to make the working of various clubs systematic.

projects.title: Brief-Me
projects.intro: Brief-Me is a modern, minimalist, and lightweight URL shortening service. It helps users to build and share powerful short links, also manages to keep a track of click data which helps in analyzing and study user engagement. We will be working on scaling the service for a larger audience. This project seeks to simplify the learning process of building scalable server side applications using the best system design practises.

projects.title: fetch
projects.intro:
A community-owned REST API service for testers and developers. Fetch provides REST API endpoints for different types of placeholders, which can be easily used during testing and development without the need for creating sample data manually.
This removes the involvement of manual placeholder data input. This also helps developers with projects involving the use of REST APIs to test the functions and get accurate responses.

projects.title: ds-algo-solutions
projects.intro: A collection of solutions for Hackerrank data structures and algorithm problems in Python, JAVA, and CPP. This community-owned project aims to bring together the solutions for the ds & Algo problems across various platforms, along with the resources for learning them. Problems from Leetcode will be included soon in the project.

projects.title: startup-incubator

This will help them get customer as well as professional reviews before deployment of the actual product/ when the are in a early growing stage. This results in faster growth and cutting down unnecessary rollback expenses post-deployment.

projects.title: notation-converter
projects.intro: Notification-converter is an application that converts infix, prefix and postfix notations from one notation to another, and also visualizes the process of conversion. This helps students easily grasp the fundamentals, such as the way of calculation, as well as the data structures used behind the scenes

projects.title: ImageX
projects.intro:
ImageX is an open-source image processing desktop app. It
provides some features like super-resolution, object detection, image
compression, and image fusion (multifocus)

projects.title: Graph-Visualization
projects.intro:
An interactive webapp for graph algorithms and their visualizations.
There are two basic objectives of the project :
1. Perform queries and modifications on a graph/tree (Shortest paths, connected components, bipartite check, max flow, etc)
and 
2. Visualize the results from Step 1.

While we initially planned the project to be written in JavaScript, we'd be excited to see if one can leverage on goroutines and optimize computations on disconnected components seperately.

projects.title: CryptoPy
projects.intro: CryptoPy is a cryptocurrency-trading assistant that provides real-time price prediction using machine learning for a currency of user's choice and displays various technical indicators and a suitable trade signal (buy or sell) for the same.

projects.title: Smart Teaching
projects.intro: This project aims to promote the online teaching culture started after the covid-19 scene and gives a suitable platform for local teachers to go their classes from offline to online. This will be an android app having all the necessary features required for classes like notes download, meeting links, even fee payment if possible test-taking also in a simpler manner than other apps.

projects.title: CGPA_ESTIMATOR
projects.intro: This project aims to help you calculate your expected CGPA based on the grades you think you might end up getting in a semester. The input fields are Current CGPA, Total Credits Cleared so far and the subject credits and expected grades in the table given on the website. There is a provision for 12 subjects. Change the input field from 0 to the desired value. When done, press the Submit Query Button and your expected CGPA will be displayed. Try out different combinations and get an idea of how much effort to put in, in each subject in the upcoming semester to achieve your desired CGPA.

projects.title: Jagrati WebApp
projects.intro: A web application for managing day-to-day operations at Jagrati (an initiative by the students of IIITDM Jabalpur to teach poor and under-privileged children of nearby villages at IIITDM Jabalpur). Please read README.md for more information.

projects.title: The Browser Toolbox
projects.intro:
Browser extensions are very powerful tools to enhance the browsing experience. Most of the modern-day browsers such as Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, and Opera use add-ons and extensions to add functionality to existing ones. The documentation for these extensions is very well-maintained and is huge.

Many of the projects in GSoC involve converting existing standalone applications into browser extensions. So, the projects will give a heads-up and an initial boost to the journey of students towards GSoC.

The aim of the organization is to introduce the power of browser APIs to beginners to code, as well as to enhance the browsing experience of the end-user. Firstly, small scale and beginner-friendly extensions will be developed, and then they will be merged into one cross-platform extension.

Link to the organization: https://github.com/the-browser-toolbox  

Please use the above link as the link to the project, since there are other related projects in the organization as well.

projects.title: Liber
projects.intro: Liber is one of the online book app. By using this app you  have lots of opportunities for reading on different categories of books. And it is more convenient way of reading n fun also.

projects.title: Mumble

projects.title: FPL Defence Rotations
projects.intro: Built on the philosophy of selecting attackers based on their form, and defenders based on their fixtures, FPL Defence Rotations is a tool which gives you the best options to rotate your defenders from in Fantasy Premier League according to favourable oppositions who play comparatively less attacking football than the rest of the clubs.

projects.title: Apni Dukan
projects.intro: It is an e-commerce web app with an utterly responsive UI, proper user authentication using bcrypt, admin and user panel, CRUD operations in backend for managing products, categories, and users, Razorpay payment gateway, and dark mode. It was built using MERN stack and hosted using Heroku for backend, MongoDB Atlas for database, and Netlify for frontend.

projects.intro: Bloggitt is a blogging website that allows users to post their thoughts and knowledge with others.

projects.title: Full Stack Lab Websiye
projects.intro: This project contains the MEN stack Website, Which is used for any research labs and tech labs in colleges and universities to make their work online.

You can set your quarterly OKRs, pre-commit metrics, estimate possible failure modes and follow your friends.

projects.title: Backup-Restore-Utility-for-Linux

projects.title: Memelord

projects.title: C-3PO
projects.intro: C-3PO is the metadata overlord and API server for Listen To This KGP, a public Facebook group where people post songs they discover. C-3PO relies on R2-D2 to give him data and then serves an API that powers lttkgp.com and other cool functionality. We're plan on improving existing codebase and adding new features to C-3PO during KWoC and are looking forward to contributions. For checking out the codebase, check out the GitHub organization: https://github.com/lttkgp

projects.title: R2-D2
projects.intro: Facebook connector for C-3PO. R2-D2 is C-3PO's beloved sidekick, helping with fetching and managing all the Facebook group data for Listen To This KGP. He saves a copy of the Facebook public data (no user information - mostly because he can't get it even if he wanted to) and keeps it in sync with C-3PO. R2-D2 is built with Golang and uses Docker and AWS services heavily. To check out the codebase and other projects, check out: https://github.com/lttkgp

projects.title: Vendor Relief
projects.intro:
*  During COVID-19, people living in societies and apartments may not be aware of the nearby shops and vendors whether they are providing essential services or not (such as Groceries, Pharmacy, Dairy, etc) and if they may be providing the people may not know the details of the vendors(like timings, contact number and address of the shop).
* People may be facing some doubts about covid-19.
*  After knowing about these problems faced by some of the people ,we have done our best to help them out.

projects.title: DOG_TINDER_WEBSITE
projects.intro: It is a dog tinder website just like we human's have, where you can find perfect match for your dogs, there are both free and paid offers for your dogs, I had used  front-end development skills for making that and i want other developers to examine the code base and make helpful changes in it and if i found them worthy i will carry them forward..

projects.title: CodeManiacs
projects.intro:
CodeManiacs is an open source online judge created by the student developers of IIT Mandi to create practice problems and host competitive programming contests for them.
The task for the KWOC students in this project would be the following : 

1) Improve the UI - There are existing issues related to the UI which have to be fixed, and more will be created as the project commences. We also expect the mentees to come up with design ideas to improve the UI and UX.

2) Work on the contests functionality - The functionality of hosting contests is relatively new in the project and has a lot of bugs, some of which have been identified, whereas some have not been. The task at hand is to fix the identified bugs, and test the contest feature to identify other 

3) Add other enhancements and fix existing server side issues as mentioned in the repository.

projects.title: Attendance-Management-using-Face-Recognition
projects.intro: This desktop application aims to simplify the process of Attendance Management of different classes and batches using Face Recognition and user-friendly GUI. The management of data and marking of attendance is carried out in Excel files.

projects.title: Falcon
projects.intro:
Listen to what KGP is listening! Listen to this KGP is a Facebook group that lets you recommed your favorite songs to KGPians.

Falcon is the frontend of LTTKGP web app

lttkgp.com/

projects.title: potter-spells
projects.intro:
The package lists all the Harry Potter spells.
Specifically, the scripts scrape the data from the website harrypotter.wikia.com and provide all the spells.
The various python scripts provide various filters to list out the spells and enchantments (magic enchantments which are not specifically spells).

projects.title: Nyx
projects.intro:
Yet Another Cloud Storage Service!

Nyx is a cloud storage service that aims to offer multiple advantages over other services:

Flexibility in terms of storage plans and the ability to resize at any time
Offer File Sharing with access control settings and edit/view options
File previews for all file types, with support for editing on the fly for files which support it
The plan is to write Nyx from scratch. We plan on using AWS services for storage and their API for operations

projects.title: GuessMovie
projects.intro: GuessMovie is a movie Guessing game where you need to guess the movie name from the plot of the movie, along with a search engine to search for your favorite movies, TV shows, web series built using Node JS and Express Server.

projects.title: Work Today App
projects.intro:
Work Today is a simple app that aims to connect workers with hirers primarily labour and daily wage workers.
Hirers can directly request any worker to work for them. They can search according to the required job.

projects.title: Minerva
projects.intro: Backend for DYSTuss - A movie/show discussion platform. Powered by Flask-REST, MySQL and Elasticsearch!

projects.title: gICCa
projects.intro:
A CLI version of the IRCCLoud. The CLI app is developed in Go.
The app uses IRCCLoud APIs for its functionality..

projects.title: Quizzer
projects.intro: A web application that makes online events as fun and interactive as offline events.
